intro: Borbonia exaltata, commonly known as the tall borbonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant in some regions.
